intro: Owenia cepiodora, commonly known as the sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky flowers that resemble holly berries. The plant has a short, fleshy stem and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. Owenia cepiodora thrives in sandy or rocky substrates and is adapted to withstand wave action and saltwater exposure. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in coastal ecosystems.
